feed.title: xpanvictor
feed.subtitle: I love to learn from the fields of STEM. Things I learn are usually fascinating and I'll like to share 'em. Make sure to pick something new from my posts, criticize and send feedbacks to my mail.

entry.title: Reviewing the Rust language
entry.content:
I read the rust book a while ago but couldn’t progress building amazing concepts with it due to work and school. I still love and admire the style and approach the language brings with it.
This is a series documenting my journey going over the rust book and some projects I did. Below is the content list

  1. Introduction

Introduction

Rust is a systems programming language with key features and interestingly new concepts. It boasts new methods that achieve great feats unlike the tools we have before. While learning, I have an habit of documenting key points and snippets per chapter. The repository to which I’ll refer individual chapters to is here.

println!("Hello world")
entry.summary: A series documenting key components of the rust programming language. I read the book a while ago but was busy with some other things, this is documenting a summary as I review
